comment.body:
Hi, glad to see you around again.
You know you are on three separate hubs at the moment, right?
As far as I know, stats aren't stored in zeronets data_dir, so copying that, reinstalling zeronet and putting it back would probably work.

This happens likely because you don't have the root GalleryHub+ downloaded. Try downloading [GalleryHub+](/14NFfVBBAFbNdqX4nyGjyBF1BRSz7jn2QP) and pressing the button again.
See [this](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/1DMTYjzfkFHyB8yZ37sMBuTirTUp5bWLQC/1570208216) ZeroMe post for more info.

It's a longstanding bug(?) on zeronet. Either something in the peer number calculations is off or some oddity in the tracker connection(like counting the same peer twice), if I had to guess. This also happens if you request a file with very few seeders. The peers of the zite skyrocket, while that file is being downloaded.
